Q: What is the purpose of the 'MAX_TIME' input in the OS?
A1: The 'MAX_TIME' input sets the maximum time for the sequence of operations on the OS.
A2: It is used to define the upper time limit for operation sequences within the OS.
A3: To ensure operations do not exceed a certain duration, the 'MAX_TIME' input is configured on the OS.
A4: Setting the 'MAX_TIME' input limits how long the sequence of operations can take on the OS.
A5: The OS uses the 'MAX_TIME' input to cap the duration of operation sequences.

Q: Under what condition is the 'IDENT' input configuration not necessary?
A1: If a plant designation was assigned in the CPU properties, the 'IDENT' input doesn't need to be configured.
A2: The 'IDENT' input configuration can be skipped when the CPU's properties include a plant designation.
A3: No need to configure 'IDENT' input if the CPU properties already specify a plant designation.
A4: When a plant designation is present in the CPU properties, configuring the 'IDENT' input is optional.
A5: The 'IDENT' input is only required when there's no plant designation in the CPU properties.
